result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Shannon Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: DE pleads No Contest to Ct #1.  Found Guilty.  $579.00 fine/costs   Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge which is included in the fine/costs.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Shannon Hill

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Shannon Hill in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached agreement. DE knowingly waives his rights to an Atty and is advised of rights to an atty.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  
DE pleads No Contest to Ct #1.  Found Guilty.  $579.00 fine/costs   Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge which is included in the fine/costs.  
DA states victim has been notified, Court finds victim rights legislation has been complied with.

Defendant Robert Shannon Hill in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  DEF temporarily waives right to attorney to speak to DA office.  Court finds DEF has freely waived his right to an Attorney.  Court enters NG Plea.   SIBS $500   NO CONTACT with Nicholas Berge.   Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
